rev.diff:
Line 19: Line 19: â
Although virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn sexual activity with the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect, several groups, individuals, and publications have pushed for the legalization of necrophilic acts. "The NecroErotic," for example, argues that "necrophiliacs have as much right to engage in their [[orgasm]]ic release of choice as do 'normal' couples," and that "all '[[human rights|rights]]' cease the moment a person draws their last breath."<ref>Pirog, John. BOOBIES[http://home.earthlink.net/~john30/public.html/principles.htm "Necrophilic Principles,"] ''The NecroErotic''. Accessed May, 2006.</ref>
+
Although virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn sexual activity with the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect, several groups, individuals, and publications have pushed for the legalization of necrophilic acts. "The NecroErotic," for example, argues that "necrophiliacs have as much right to engage in their [[orgasm]]ic release of choice as do 'normal' couples," and that "all '[[human rights|rights]]' cease the moment a person draws their last breath."<ref>Pirog, John. [http://home.earthlink.net/~john30/public.html/principles.htm "Necrophilic Principles,"] ''The NecroErotic''. Accessed May, 2006.</ref>
===Necrophilia in neo-psychoanalysis===
